item.title: Marti add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Marti add a quote by Hubert H. Humphrey
item.description: "The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously." -- Hubert H. Humphrey

item.title: Marti add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Marti add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "If a man does his best, what else is there?" -- George S. Patton

item.title: Marti add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marti add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I'm a greater believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Marti add a quote by Simonides
item.description: "Dancing is silent poetry." -- Simonides

item.title: Marti add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Marti add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Marti add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Marti add a quote by Anna Sewell
item.description: "We call them dumb animals, and so they are, for they cannot tell us how they feel, but they do not suffer less because they have no words." -- Anna Sewell

item.title: Marti add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease." -- Voltaire

item.title: Marti add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Marti add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marti add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Marti add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Marti add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marti add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Marti add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Marti add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Marti add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Marti add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Marti add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marti add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marti add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Marti add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Marti add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marti add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Marti add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marti add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
